result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any condensed air/inhalants other than the way they are to be used. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

2:05 PM Defendant Stephanie R Adamich in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Stephanie R Adamich. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Eryn Menden will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
